sentences.en: He managed to get his ugly mug on the telly.
sentences.cn: 他设法让自己那张丑陋的脸上了电视。

sentences.en: I like her in a kind, but she is ugly.
sentences.cn: 我有点喜欢她, 但她长得丑.

sentences.en: I thought they were laughing at me because I was ugly.
sentences.cn: 我觉得他们嘲笑我是因为我长得丑。

sentences.en: Nick’s dog is as ugly as sin (= very ugly ).
Roy was tremendously ugly, mega ugly.
She painted herself thick and ugly.
sentences.cn: 她脸上粉搽得又厚又难看.

sentences.en: She was a shy, ugly duckling of a child.
sentences.cn: 她小时候是个羞怯的丑小鸭。

sentences.en: The extreme right reared its ugly head in the 1980s.
sentences.cn: 极右势力在20世纪80年代有所抬头。

sentences.en: The knee-length dresses were unflattering and ugly.
sentences.cn: 齐膝长裙既不显身材又不好看。

sentences.en: The Memorial seems almost ugly, dominating the landscape for miles around.
sentences.cn: 那座纪念碑耸立在方圆数英里景致之中显得近乎难看。

sentences.en: There were ugly scenes in the streets last night as rioting continued.
sentences.cn: 昨晚暴乱持续之际，街上险象环生。

sentences.en: What ugly things; throw them away, throw them away.
sentences.cn: 多难看的东西啊，扔掉，扔掉。

words.tran_cn: 把…弄成难看；将…丑化；糟蹋

phrases.tran_cn: 丑小鸭；小时难看长大后变得才貌出众的人

trans.tran_cn: 难看的，丑陋的，有敌意的，不祥的
trans.tran_en: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at
